I did another pass. I just marked two instances where we could be a little more proactive with detecting errors. 

One thing makes me nervous: There are no tests for `DataReader` / `DataWriter`. I'm OK with merging without tests in the interest of unblocking things. We should file a JIRA to make sure we eventually add the tests, though. @beysims, @jwang98052: What do you think?
I'll test this.
I tested both java and .net. All tests pass. I will merge.
@beysims, @jwang98052 and I spoke offline. We will proceed with the merge and file a JIRA for the tests.

[Reef-pull-request-windows #286](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-windows/286/) SUCCESS
This pull request looks good

@afchung thanks for the PR!

I did a mostly cosmetics-focused pass. The main points are:
1. Add JavaDocs to all new classes. If the class is just an implementation of a REST object, please add that information to the javadoc as well as a link to the YARN API docs, if any. If the class is genuinely ours, please add javadocs to all public members.
   1. Make whatever you can `final`. IntelliJ has a Code Inspector to help you with that.
   2. The code already had hand-written `.toString()` methods for JSON objects. Instead of repeating that probably bad idea, maybe we can use jackson to generate the strings?

Of course, all these changes only apply to new or updated code. It is appreciated, but not necessary to fix my mistakes from the past :-)

Please commit additional changes into this same branch. The final committer will take care of the squashing and commit message cleanup. Please comment on this thread when you want us to take another look.

I've done a pass. A bunch of cosmetics, but also one design question: We now require the user to pass a `TcpPortProvider` to the `RemoteManagerFactory.getInstance()`. It seems cleaner to me to have that provider injected into the `RemoteManagerFactory` instead.

Put the PR link in REEF-304
You can push to Microsoft-CISL instead of your forked repository next time
I don't think I have access to Microsoft-CISL.
I'll test and merge this in the meantime.
I filled [REEF-310](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-310) for the overall issue.
@afchung did you test this on HDI? If so, I can go ahead and merge it.

For the same tasks, class hierarchy are the same. Unless the clients submit context every time for different tasks. Even in that case, most cases, clients would put all the task dlls in the class hierarchy at once. So load it once at java side make sense. 
I also tested it last night in .Net. The change looks good.

This pull request looks good
The new submission serialization only works on 3.2, so a 3.2 cluster would be good. Thanks!
@afchung , are we assuming that pre-3.2 cluster will no longer be supported with this change?

Yes. However, note that clusters earlier than 3.2 that are available from the Azure portal do not actually support REST job submission. ASA and REEF were only able to do it because we got a patch from the HDInsight team to expose the REST submission API. Also, the configuration were misconfigured before my change (the submission handler was setting the same parameter in two different configurations and merging them, causing a conflict), so it was not working before anyway.
OK. Thanks for the confirmation @afchung
Closing this, as @yingdachen found a bug in it. Thanks!
